Well she certainly is a high skill cap champ, like Lee Sin, but that doesn't make them difficult to play. Landing Anivia's combo was easy before. Just mastering them are difficult.

It's not high skillcap, it's more based on positioning, and also the wall.

Kinda like how {{champion:22}} her self isn't that hard to play but you need to not go balls deep and position correctly.
Landing her ult could be as hard to landing a good anivia wall in terms of difficulty to master.

That does sound like you're describing skill cap though. Skill cap = higher the skill cap, higher the potential. The better you are, the more potential you draw out from the individual champion. Every champion has a skill cap, some higher than others. Anivia on the other hand you can disrupt most engages and use move displacement. "Landing her ult could be as hard to landing a good anivia wall in terms of difficulty to master." Yes this is considered skill cap. 

Positioning is a universal skill set that contributes to skill cap for every champion and wall is just another utility skill shot technically. I agree Ashe is one of the easiest ADC's to start playing and learning but that doesn't necessarily mean you've even grasped the concept of playing Ashe. For instance, Ashe is one of those champs who's easy to play but difficult to master. When you master, Ashe has a high skill cap with her global ult. Now of course they don't compare to someone like Lee. Sure Ashe is no Twisted Fate in terms of high skill cap but we're talking about individual potential. Anivia and Ashe's potential is pretty good and they scale pretty well late game.

Anivia can use her wall to block just about any gap close except blinks. Ashe can snipe stun from anywhere on the map.

High skillcap is like {{champion:67}} kiting(ft. Gosu), {{champion:64}} pro comboes, and things more pertaining to mechanical skills. Everyone needs to position; it's nothing special or unique to Anivia. What is unique is her wall. 

Yes her wall is skill cap, positioning, because it applies to every champ does not contribute to skill cap. 
It's like you have to itemize all champs depending on matchup, so having a large pool of items makes a champ's skill cap higher. 

Ehh... ashe isn't difficult to master. Just position well and aim the ult good, as I said. 

Having potential to scale to lategame doesn't increase skillcap. Otherwise all lategame scaling champs would be automatically hard to play.

She can still feel super frustrating to play against, especially if you're not used to playing against her. It's like how LeBlanc is actually hard to play, except you actually still have options against a good Anivia.

First off it's an overall buff, I have no idea how it's a nerf in any way.

Passive-same

Q- compensation nerfed but the damage wasn't the main part of the move anyways

W- same

E- now easier to cast but I do wish they didn't increase projectile speed.

R- now easier to do her E->R combo due to range increase and if she really wants to sustain damage in a fight it's even better

This is in no way an anivia nerf unless you just never understood anivia in the first place.

She's always been a medium skill floor and high skill ceiling champion just with the little bits of knowledge you should possess as an anivia player

If she really needs buffing they can increase the e and r range by 50 but otherwise it's a buff.

> R- now easier to do her E->R combo due to range increase

> This is in no way an anivia nerf unless you just never understood anivia in the first place.

That's ironic. If you understood anivia before, you'd know that her ult had a 625 cast range and a 400 unit radius. You could effectively cast it up to 1,025 units away.
It now has a 685 unit cast range and a 150 unit radius. This means you cannot cast it further than 835 units away-- effectively cutting 190 off its max range (at least, until you've waited more than 2.5 seconds).

The range difference isn't the biggest problem, but I just wanted to point it out. This makes her less safe against Luxes (1175 and 1100 range), Zed (900 range on Q, 700 on shadow), and other lane opponents.

It is the right direction. But it isn't there so she is just kinda left in limbo.

Her ult being an activator for her e and nothing else is a really lame ultimate regardless of how strong she is.

I think they should have gotten rid of the toggle altogether though. Just make it a slowly expanding zone that puts a small slow (like 10%) and a small amount of damage without much scaling but not tied to her mana. Even make it so she can put up more than one with rank 2 ulti and some cdr allowing her to turn part of the map basically into a blizzard (but make it so the damage doesn't stack).

She could use it with her wall to block off multiple choke points forcing the enemy to go through her ulti and fight at a small disadvantage with the slow and constant damage.

Only disadvantage is without decent damage scaling on her ult it would possibly force her into the support role. So maybe the slow could have some ap scaling too.

If they did that they would have to change her e though because she would have no reliable activator and it's the part of her kit that people don't like to fight anyway.
